section_title: Master of Science (MSc) in Economics and Business Administration in Accounting, Strategy and Control (Part 17)
text_chunk:
i erhvervsøkonomi i regnskab, strategi og økonomistyring)
is a graduate-level, theoretical programme that research-based programme that serves as a continuation and builds upon the business economics foundations from the BSc Programme in Economics and Business Administration (HA) and equivalent programmes (please see section 1A, subsection (1) and (2) for the full list.
(2) The objective of the
Master of Science (MSc) in Economics and Business Administration in Accounting, Strategy and Control
is that students should acquire the scientific skills and competencies to identify and develop solutions to business economics issues in private and public enterprises and organisations.
(3) The programme will help students acquire these skills and competencies by providing them with both a general understanding and specialised knowledge, to the effect that the graduate in the solving of problems pertaining to business economics may employ in-depth knowledge of the field as well as independently acquire, produce and utilise new knowledge.
(4) Through participation in the programme, students should also acquire the ability to collaborate with people having the same or another academic background in working with and solving problems that involve a variety of fields.
Competency profile
Purpose and academic profile
3.
The Master of Science (MSc) in Economics and Business Administration in Accounting, Strategy and Control is a research-based graduate level program in business economics.

page_name: Master of Science (MSc) in Economics and Business Administration in Accounting, Strategy and Control
section_title: Master of Science (MSc) in Economics and Business Administration in Accounting, Strategy and Control (Part 18)
text_chunk: It has an overall focus on provides the candidate with a framework embedded in economic, accounting and finance theory for designing, analyzing and implementing accounting and control systems decisive for decision making, coordination, motivation and control in organizations.

page_name: Master of Science (MSc) in Economics and Business Administration in Accounting, Strategy and Control
section_title: Master of Science (MSc) in Economics and Business Administration in Accounting, Strategy and Control (Part 19)
text_chunk: The Accounting, Strategy and Control program provides the candidate with strong competences in designing, analyzing and implementing accounting and control systems vital for the strategic alignment in modern organizations, as well as business economic theory and methods.

page_name: Master of Science (MSc) in Economics and Business Administration in Accounting, Strategy and Control
section_title: Master of Science (MSc) in Economics and Business Administration in Accounting, Strategy and Control (Part 20)
text_chunk:
The program focuses particularly on how business enterprises can make economic decisions under uncertainty, and hence make the best use of limited, or scarce, resources, while taking into account an economically, socially and environmentally sustainable development of society.
The specific competency profile is obtained through the combination of core business economics and methodology courses within the programme and the Master’s degree thesis, which – unless the student decides to complete a minor - must be written within the specific focus of the programme.

page_name: Master of Science (MSc) in Economics and Business Administration in Accounting, Strategy and Control
section_title: Master of Science (MSc) in Economics and Business Administration in Accounting, Strategy and Control (Part 21)
text_chunk:
The programme provides graduates with long-term thinking and the competencies to handle change and complexity towards sustainable development.
Learning outcomes
Upon completion of the program, the student:
Has research-based knowledge at the highest international level within business economics
Can understand and on a scientific basis reflect on the field’s knowledge and characterize its practical relevance in a relevant organizational and societal context
Masters the theories, scientific methods and tools of business economics as well as the general skills linked to employment in broader business contexts
Can assess and choose among the business economic theories, methods, tools and general skills to solve economic and business problems and ethical dilemmas, and on a scientific basis develop new analytical models and new options
Can communicate research-based knowledge and discuss professional and scientific issues in a way that make them relevant and comprehensible to peers and non-specialists alike
Can manage work and development situations that are complex, ambiguous, and unpredictable and that require continuous learning and sometimes new solutions
Can independently initiate and complete professional and cross-disciplinary collaboration and assume professional responsibility
Can create value from global connections for local communities
Understands the impact and limitations of management accounting models and methods for the entire organization as well as business partners and society in entirety.
Recognizes that stakeholders’ interests can be conflicting and can range from financial value creation to fairness of incentive programs for employees.
Can analyse cost, profitability and value drivers that determine organisational value creation
Understands financial as well as non-financial measures relevant for analysing and controlling value creation processes in organisations
Can measure growth, risk and performance in businesses and estimate the value of businesses
Can apply cost, performance and risk analyses for business decision-making
Understands the factors that determine the value of specific risk, cost and performance measures and issues in organisations and at individual employee level
Understands how data and analytics are influencing the management accounting profession
Can describe how data is acquired and prepared for analysis and apply data analysis principles to facilitate management accounting decisions
Understands corporate sustainability accounting, finance, accountability, and reporting issues and the continuing debates within the literature
Can use sustainability dashboards and control panels and understands their use in order to focus, align and report on measures across organizations
Understands and can apply traditional as well as new management accounting concepts and their relevance and adjustment to specific organisational settings
Can present analyses and business insights both in writing and verbally in a structured manner that is comprehensible to managers at all levels and with different backgrounds

page_name: Master of Science (MSc) in Economics and Business Administration in Accounting, Strategy and Control

text_chunk:
The programme will also give access to take electives, enabling you to go even further into specific areas.
(2) As a rule, the language of instruction and exam will be English.
(3) The programme comprises four blocks, each constituting 25% of the programme:
The programme-specific block
The methodological block
The elective block
The thesis block
The first two blocks are taught as far as possible as a coherent and integrated whole.
(4) The programme-specific block comprises related scientific areas that together with the Master’s thesis reflect the academic profile of the programme.
(5) The methodological block comprises disciplines that students need to be able to use in the course work of the programme-specific block and which are important for solving business economics issues or for further developing business economic and cross-disciplinary models.
(6) The courses in the programme-specific block and the methodological block, totalling 60 ECTS, are taken in the 1st and 2nd semesters.The elective courses, totalling 30 ECTS, are taken in the 3rd semester.

Purpose
2.
The MSc in Economics and Finance is a research-based programme at the master’s level with a focus on theoretical relationships and empirical applications.
(2) The programme places significant emphasis on the ability to analyze decisions within a broad economic context, make well-informed business decisions, and comprehend the societal impact of those choices.
Students learn to work independently with economic and/or financial problems and thus obtain qualifications to work as specialized analysts in particular in financial institutions but also in the business community in general wherever strong, quantitative financial and economic skills are needed.
The programme offers two concentrations which the students must choose between:
Advanced Economics and Finance
Applied Economics and Finance
Competency profile
3.
The Study Board has developed a competency profile, which describes the expected learning outcomes of this degree programme.
Competency profile for the MSc in Economics and Finance Program
Copenhagen Business School’s Master of Science in Economics and Finance offers a comprehensive curriculum in economics, finance, and quantitative methods.

page_name: Master of Science in Economics and Finance
section_title: Master of Science in Economics and Finance (Part 17)
text_chunk: This program places significant emphasis on the ability to analyze decisions within a broad economic context, make well-informed business decisions, and comprehend the societal impact of those choices.

page_name: Master of Science in Economics and Finance
section_title: Master of Science in Economics and Finance (Part 18)
text_chunk: Moreover, it leverages state-of-the-art data-driven quantitative techniques to collect, analyze, and interpret data and fosters the capacity to critically evaluate and enhance business decisions while considering social welfare implications.

page_name: Master of Science in Economics and Finance
section_title: Master of Science in Economics and Finance (Part 19)
text_chunk: Additionally, the program recognizes the paramount importance of international collaboration and embraces the advantages of a diverse and multicultural learning environment.

page_name: Master of Science in Economics and Finance
section_title: Master of Science in Economics and Finance (Part 20)
text_chunk: The MSc in Economics and Finance equips students to effectively tackle intricate economic challenges and flourish in today's fiercely competitive business landscape.

page_name: Master of Science in Economics and Finance
section_title: Master of Science in Economics and Finance (Part 21)
text_chunk:
The program consists of the following two concentrations:
ADVANCED ECONOMICS AND FINANCE
Purpose and academic profile
The highly selective concentration in Advanced Economics and Finance provides graduates with a unique combination of deep knowledge, skills, and competences to pursue business careers in financial institutions, consulting firms, international corporations, and academia.

page_name: Master of Science in Economics and Finance
section_title: Master of Science in Economics and Finance (Part 22)
text_chunk: It is an excellent stepping-stone to pursue a PhD career. Students will acquire in-depth knowledge of state-of-the-art advanced theories and methodologies in economics, finance, and econometrics and their empirical relevance.

page_name: Master of Science in Economics and Finance
section_title: Master of Science in Economics and Finance (Part 23)
text_chunk: Students develop the academic skills and knowledge to discuss, critically reflect on, quantitatively analyze, and solve problems related to complex economic and financial decision-making as investors, in corporations, and for the betterment of society.

page_name: Master of Science in Economics and Finance
section_title: Master of Science in Economics and Finance (Part 24)
text_chunk: Moreover, they gain expertise in understanding and forecasting market fluctuations and drivers, market regulation, and exploring cutting-edge ideas in academic research.

page_name: Master of Science in Economics and Finance
section_title: Master of Science in Economics and Finance (Part 25)
text_chunk:
Overall, the Advanced Economics and Finance concentration is an excellent choice for academically curios students seeking to reach the forefront of academic research in economic and finance in order to succeed in today's competitive business world.
Competencies
Upon graduation, candidates possess:
• A profound theoretical and empirical knowledge of economics, finance, and quantitative methods based on frontier academic research, particularly focusing on the interactions of economic agents (individuals, firms, and regulators) in markets.
• The ability to conduct analyses of extensive quantitative and/or qualitative datasets, critically reflect on the potential conclusions that can be drawn and actions that can be taken based on the analyses, while considering model uncertainty and distinguishing between correlation and causality.
• Critical evaluation and enhancement of decisions made by firms and other economic agents, considering their impact on society and the long-term challenges and needs of humanity.
• An understanding of the trade-off between the private value of an action and its impact on global, local, and intergenerational social welfare.
• Critical reflection on existing research methods and current academic research, enabling transformative exploration of its practical applications.
• The ability to work constructively in a collaborative, international, and multicultural context, appreciating the advantages of such a collaborative learning environment.
APPLIED ECONOMICS AND FINANCE
Purpose and academic profile
The Applied Economics and Finance concentration equips graduates with the necessary knowledge, skills, and competencies to analyze the economic context in which firms operate, evaluate financial risks, and make sound financial decisions in various business environments.

page_name: Master of Science in Economics and Finance
section_title: Master of Science in Economics and Finance (Part 26)
text_chunk: Emphasizing state-of-the-art data-driven quantitative methodologies, the concentration is highly relevant for aspiring managers, business leaders, and entrepreneurs.

page_name: Master of Science in Economics and Finance
section_title: Master of Science in Economics and Finance (Part 27)
text_chunk: The curriculum offers a solid foundation in quantitative methods, economic theory, business knowledge, and financial management practices relevant for firms. Graduates have a wide range of career options, including management, finance, and consulting.

page_name: Master of Science in Economics and Finance
section_title: Master of Science in Economics and Finance (Part 28)
text_chunk:
Overall, the Applied Economics and Finance concentration is an excellent choice for students seeking to enhance their knowledge and skills in economics and finance to succeed in today's competitive business world.
Competencies
Upon graduation, candidates possess:
• A deep research-based knowledge at the highest international level in applied economics, finance, and quantitative methods.
• The capability to analyze and understand the broad economic context in which firms operate and make business decisions.
• The capability to collect, combine, and analyze standard and non-standard data using state-of-the-art applied quantitative techniques.

page_name: Master of Science in Economics and Finance
section_title: Master of Science in Economics and Finance (Part 29)
text_chunk:
They also possess the ability to understand, interpret, and communicate the economic, human, and business relevance of the obtained results.
• The capability to use theoretical arguments and empirical findings to identify major social and human challenges and formulate potential business-focused solutions.
• The capability to use economic arguments and empirical results to formulate competitive strategies, plans, and decisions in business environments full of risk and uncertainties, without losing an understanding of the potential human dilemmas involved.
• The capability to find business solutions that make the best sustainable use of scarce resources.
• The capability to work in international and diverse groups to find sustainable business solutions to important economic and societal challenges.

4.

Extraordinary re-exams and offers of re-assessment/re-exam
17.
If an extraordinary re-examination is arranged or offered in accordance with section 30 of the Examination Order (regarding examination irregularities) or the offer of a re-evaluation/re-examination is given in accordance with section 38 or 41 of the Examination Order (regarding complaints about the exam), the re-examination is subject to the learning objectives of the ordinary examination of the examination in question.
(2) Examinations under subsection 1 can be conducted in accordance with the regulations of the re-exam if the examination is an offer of an extraordinary re-exam.

Examination forms
19.
Examinations are organised as individual examinations or as group examinations.

text_chunk:
The specific examination form of a given examination, including whether it is an individual or a group examination, or a mixture of the two, is stated in the relevant course description, see links in section 5.
(2) At both individual and group examinations the student’s individual performance must be assessed, and grading must be individual, see subsections (3)-(4).
(3) At oral group examinations the individual student must be examined in such a way that it is ensured that the student’s individual performance is assessed.
(4) If a written product is produced by more than one student, and if there is no oral defence of the product, it must be stated in the group product which parts of the product the individual student has written, so that individual assessments can be made of the individual students’ performances.

the allotted time at the oral examination – see subsection (3)

Both the written product and the oral presentation count in the assessment.

Assessment
24.
Examinations are either internal or external:
Internal examinations are assessed by one or more teachers (internal examiners) appointed by CBS from among the teachers at the university or from other universities that offer the same or similar study programmes.
External examinations are assessed by one or more internal examiners and one external examiner (in Danish: censor) appointed by the Danish Agency for Higher Education and Science.
(2) It is stipulated in the exam regulations of the individual examination whether it is an internal or an external examination, see link in section 5.
(3) Assessment of the examinations is carried out in accordance with the Grading Scale Order.
(4) Compulsory assignments and class participation, see section 13, are assessed by the teacher(s) of the specific course.

page_name: Master of Science in Economics and Finance
section_title: Master of Science in Economics and Finance (Part 104)
text_chunk:
The assessment type ‘Approved/Not approved’ is used.

25.
In connection with examinations where the result is not announced immediately after the examination, the result must be announced within 4 weeks after the examination has been held, see however subsection (2).

text_chunk:
The month of July is not included in the calculation of these 4 weeks.

(3) When special circumstances warrant it, the Programme Director can set aside the deadlines stipulated in subsections (1) and (2).

Each examination must be passed separately.

An examination shall be passed when the student achieves a grade of at least 02 or the assessment ‘Pass’.

32.
Programme elements passed at another university are regarded as equivalent to corresponding programme elements covered by these programme regulations.

Students who, as part of their studies, wish to complete programme elements at another university or another institution of higher education in Denmark or abroad may apply to their home university for pre-approved credit transfer for planned programme elements.
(2) Approval of pre-approved credit transfer pursuant to subsection (1) may only be granted if, in connection with the application for preapproved credit transfer, the student undertakes to submit to the home university the necessary documentation to show whether the programme elements have been passed or failed upon completion of the programme elements for which pre-approved credit transfer has been granted.

(4) In cases where the programme elements for which pre-approved credit transfer has been granted are, for example, not offered by the host institution, the university may, upon the student's request, change the approval of pre-approved credit transfer pursuant to subsection (1).

Part 4: Concentrations
Advanced Economics and Finance
Purpose and academic profile
43.
This concentration will provide the students with in-depth knowledge of state-of-the-art advanced theories and methodologies in economics, finance, and econometrics and their empirical relevance.

page_name: Master of Science in Economics and Finance
section_title: Master of Science in Economics and Finance (Part 142)
text_chunk: Students develop the academic skills and knowledge to discuss, critically reflect on, quantitatively analyze, and solve problems related to complex economic and financial decision-making as investors, in corporations, and for the betterment of society.

page_name: Master of Science in Economics and Finance
section_title: Master of Science in Economics and Finance (Part 143)
text_chunk: Moreover, they gain expertise in understanding and forecasting market fluctuations and drivers, market regulation, and exploring cutting-edge ideas in academic research.These competence will be achieved through a portfolio of advanced high-level academic courses and other scholary activities within economics and finance.

page_name: Master of Science in Economics and Finance
section_title: Master of Science in Economics and Finance (Part 144)
text_chunk:
The Advanced Economics and Finance concentration stresses in-deapt understanding of theories, methods, and models.
The Advanced Economics and Finance concentration prepares the student for business careers in financial institutions, consulting firms, international corporations, and academia.

44.
The concentration comprises of the courses below, the extents of which are expressed in ECTS credits.

online course catalogue

During the third semester it is expected that the students take the equivalent of four 7.5 ECTS electives.

page_name: Master of Science in Economics and Finance
section_title: Master of Science in Economics and Finance (Part 148)
text_chunk:
The electives can be taken at a university abroad or by following courses at a Danish university.
(2) All of the electives must fall within the programme’s area of quantitative economics or finance.
(3) Two of these electives (corresponding to 15 ECTS) must represent progression compared with the courses at the first structured year.
(4) Maximum one of the electives (corresponding to 7.5 ECTS) can be of an applied nature (e.g.

page_name: Master of Science in Economics and Finance
section_title: Master of Science in Economics and Finance (Part 149)
text_chunk:
be highly applied in its nature – as opposed to theoretical, and/or lie somewhat outside the immediate field of study that characterizes the programme).
(5) With pre-approval in view, the study board offers to evaluate the elective courses offered by other Danish or international universities
.
Applied Economics and Finance
Purpose and academic profile
46.
This concentration will train the student to become knowledgeable in two main fields: industrial organisation and financial markets.

page_name: Master of Science in Economics and Finance
section_title: Master of Science in Economics and Finance (Part 150)
text_chunk: Moreover, the students will learn to understand and to forecast macroeconomic variables that are important for a firm, and they will learn how to use their analytical training to solve practical problems and to communicate their results clearly.

page_name: Master of Science in Economics and Finance
section_title: Master of Science in Economics and Finance (Part 151)
text_chunk:
Analytical skills, of the type a business economist should command, are what the Applied Economics and Finance concentration aims to enhance.
This competence will be achieved through courses taking the firm as the starting point.

page_name: Master of Science in Economics and Finance
section_title: Master of Science in Economics and Finance (Part 152)
text_chunk:
The concentration of Applied Economics and Finance stresses mastery of core methods of modern macro- and micro-economics: applied industrial organisation, applied financial relations, modern international trade, and applied theories of internal firm organisation.
The concentration of Applied Economics and Finance prepares the student for analytically oriented positions that can serve as background for later achievements in business in general.
Structure, Contents, and Progression
47.
The concentration comprises of the courses below, the extents of which are expressed in ECTS credits.The course descriptions are available in the
online course catalogue
.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 9)
text_chunk:
Kandidatuddannelsen er et fuldtidsstudium på 2 år normeret til 120 ECTS-point. Fristen for at afslutte uddannelsen er normeret studietid + 1 år efter den studerende har påbegyndt uddannelsen. Evt. orlovsperioder tæller ikke med i den angivne tidsramme.
Stk. 4.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 10)
text_chunk: Kandidatuddannelsen udbydes også som erhvervskandidatuddannelse normeret til 120 ECTS, tilrettelagt som et fireårigt deltidsforløb. Fristen for at afslutte uddannelsen er normeret studietid + 1 år efter den studerende har påbegyndt uddannelsen, jf. også stk. 5. Evt.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 11)
text_chunk:
orlovsperioder tæller ikke med i den angivne tidsramme.
Stk. 5. Hvad angår fristen for at afslutte uddannelsen for studerende, der skifter fra erhvervskandidatuddannelsen til heltidsordningen, vil den studerendes studiefremfærd blive omregnet til en ny normtid.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 12)
text_chunk:
Oveni den sammenregnede normerede studietid har den studerende maksimalt et år yderligere til at færdiggøre uddannelsen. Evt. orlovsperioder tæller ikke med i den angivne tidsramme.
Stk. 6.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 13)
text_chunk: Uddannelseslængden angiver det antal studenterårsværk, der er lagt til grund ved tilrettelæggelsen af uddannelsen.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 14)
text_chunk: Et studenterårsværk er en fuldtidsstuderendes arbejde i et år og svarer til en årlig arbejdsbelastning på 1650 arbejdstimer svarende til 60 point i European Credit Transfer System (ECTS-point).

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 15)
text_chunk:
Arbejdsbelastningen omfatter skemalagt undervisning, hjemmeforberedelse, udarbejdelse af skriftlige arbejder, projekter, øvrige aktiviteter i forbindelse med undervisningen samt selvstudium og eksamensforberedelse og -deltagelse.
Stk. 7.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 16)
text_chunk:
Uddannelsen har følgende placering/niveau i den Europæiske Kvalifikationsramme for Livslang Læring og Bologna-kvalifikationsrammen: NQF/EQF-niveau 7, svarende til den anden cyklus i Bologna-kvalifikationsrammen.
Adgangskrav og adgangsgivende uddannelser
§ 1A.
Der er ingen uddannelser, der giver ret til optagelse på kandidatuddannelsen i revision på CBS.
Stk.

text_chunk: 3. Adgang til kandidatuddannelsen i revision forudsætter, at ansøgeren har gennemført en adgangsgivende bacheloruddannelse, herunder professionsbacheloruddannelse, eller anden dansk eller udenlandsk uddannelse på samme niveau.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 21)
text_chunk:
Under uddannelsen skal ansøgeren i tilstrækkelig grad ud fra en samlet, individuel vurdering have dækket følgende fagområder:
15 ECTS-points i regnskab og/eller økonomistyring
15 ECTS-points i mikroøkonomi og/eller makroøkonomi
7,5 ECTS-points i erhvervsret
7,5 ECTS-points i organisation og/eller ledelse og/eller strategi
7,5 ECTS-points i finansiering
7,5 ECTS-points i generel erhvervsøkonomi
15 ECTS-points i samfundsvidenskabelig metode (herunder statistik/kvantitativ metode)
Stk.

cbs.dk/kandidatoptag
.
Supplerende adgangskrav
§ 1B.
Senest ved indstilling til prøverne i uddannelsens valgfag skal de studerende, der er optaget på baggrund af den erhvervsøkonomiske diplomprøve, have bestået en særprøve i udvalgte erhvervsøkonomiske områder med minimum karakteren 02.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 25)
text_chunk:
Studienævnet har tilrettelagt et særligt fag med henblik på denne prøve (HD-suppleringsfag). Faget har et omfang på 20 ECTS-point. Yderligere informationer om faget kan findes i fagets kursusbeskrivelse.
Stk. 2. Bestås prøven ikke, kan den tages om.
Stk. 3.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 26)
text_chunk: Prøven kan erstattes af tilsvarende prøve(r) ved en anden institution, hvor kandidatuddannelsen i revision finder sted.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 27)
text_chunk: I tilfælde af manglende ECTS-point til opfyldelse af kravet om 20 ECTS, kan studienævnet i særlige tilfælde give dispensation til en mundtlig prøve med udgangspunkt i en synopsis på min.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 28)
text_chunk:
5 sider.
Supplerende krav til adgang og optagelse vedrørende erhvervskandidatordningen
§ 1C.
Se nærmere på CBS' hjemmeside vedrørende kravene til adgang og optagelse på erhvervskandidatordningen:
cand.merc.aud.'s optagsider
.
Formål
§ 2.
Kandidatuddannelsen i revision (cand.merc.aud.-studiet) er en videregående teoretisk uddannelse på kandidatniveau.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 29)
text_chunk:
Den kvalificerer til udøvelse af revision af private og offentlige virksomheder og institutioner. Uddannelsen udgør den teoretiske del af uddannelsen til statsautoriseret revisor.
Stk. 2.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 30)
text_chunk: Uddannelsen skal bibringe de studerende et grundlæggende kendskab til revisorhvervet og dets funktioner i almindelighed og revision i særdeleshed, således at det teoretiske grundlag for løsningen af revisors arbejdsopgaver beherskes.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 31)
text_chunk:
Denne kompetence opnås ved, at den studerende gennem uddannelsen bibringes såvel helhedsopfattelse samt specialviden, således at kandidaten ved løsning af problemer kan udnytte dels det dybtgående kendskab til fagområdet og dels selvstændigt tilegne sig, producere og anvende ny viden samt i samarbejde med andre at kunne behandle og løse tværgående problemstillinger.
Kompetenceprofil
§ 3. Kompetenceprofil for Cand.merc.aud - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
Formål og akademisk profil
Cand.merc.aud.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 32)
text_chunk: udgør den krævede teoretiske baggrund, jf.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 33)
text_chunk:
Revisorloven og tilhørende bekendtgørelser for at blive godkendt revisor.
Uddannelsen kvalificerer CMA kandidater til at forstå og udfylde revisors rolle som offentlighedens tillidsrepræsentant, hvis arbejde skaber troværdighed og transparens i virksomheders økonomiske rapportering til omverdenen, og dermed medvirker til at sikre, at der træffes gode økonomiske beslutninger.
Uddannelsen kvalificerer også til arbejde i økonomifunktioner i både den private og offentlige sektor, hvor CMA kandidater med en regnskabsmæssig professionsidentitet forstår at bidrage til at skabe et troværdigt og relevant beslutningsgrundlag for både interne og eksterne beslutningstagere.
Endelig kvalificerer uddannelsen til udøvelse af erhvervsretlig og skattemæssig rådgivning og kontrol og dermed til at sikre, at virksomheder efterlever samfundets regulering.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 34)
text_chunk:
Gennem et bredt valgfagsudbud giver uddannelsen endvidere den studerende mulighed for at tilegne sig specielle kompetencer, som kan kvalificere til ansættelse i specialistfunktioner og/eller give en uddybende forståelse af den generelle faglige viden.
Læringsudbytte
CMA uddannelsen består af fag som giver den færdige CMA kandidat et omfattende kendskab til revisorerhvervet og den relevante regulering af både virksomheders regnskabsaflæggelse og øvrige rapportering, samt den herfor relevante erhvervs- og skattemæssige regulering.
Den færdige CMA kandidat har opnået viden, værdier og handlingsmæssige kompetencer, der gør, at vedkommende:
Forstår at udøvelsen af professional skepsis er fundamentet for at revisor kan handle som offentlighedens tillidsrepræsentant, og kan i arbejdet som revisor udvise professionel skepsis i forhold til de informationer og data, som modtages fra virksomheden eller en tredjepart.
Kan fremskaffe de for en given problemstilling relevante data og informationer.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 35)
text_chunk: CMA kandidater har kritisk sans og evner ud fra denne at analysere data og informationer i forhold til beslutningstagernes behov.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 36)
text_chunk:
De forstår endvidere, at ambiguitet i forskellige interessenters informationsbehov samt i data og information er normalt forekommende og de kan håndtere dette.
Kan erkende og analysere de etiske problemstillinger, som både revisorer og producenter af økonomisk- og anden information kan komme ud for, herunder etiske problemstillinger forbundet med erhvervs- og skatteretlig rådgivning.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 37)
text_chunk:
CMA kandidater er uddannet til at handle etisk forsvarligt uanset hvilken type ansættelse de har eller hvilken funktion de udøver.
Forstår at deres arbejde, uanset om de er revisorer eller arbejder med regnskabsmæssige opgaver i virksomheder, er omfattet af såvel national som international regulering.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 38)
text_chunk:
CMA kandidater forstår at fortolke international regulering og gøre denne forståelig i en lokal kontekst.
Identificerer sig med revisorprofessionen og lever op til de krav og forventninger samfundet har til denne ved at efterleve relevant regulering.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 39)
text_chunk: CMA kandidater forstår endvidere, at uddannelsens fagområder er dynamiske og kræver, at de holder deres uddannelse ajourført, og uddannelsen giver dem evnerne til dette.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 40)
text_chunk:
De forstår også, at professionsidentiteten indebærer, at de deler deres viden, værdier og handlingsmæssige kompetencer med andre.
Har blik for samfundets miljø, sociale og styringsmæssige udfordringer (ESG) og forstår hvorledes de som revisorer, rådgivere eller ved udarbejdelse af ESG rapportering kan bidrage til, at der træffes gode samfundsmæssige beslutninger, som værner om fremtidige generationers ressourcer.
Kan samarbejde med interne såvel som eksterne interessenter med henblik på at opnå resultater jf.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 41)
text_chunk:
ovenstående.
Indhold og struktur
§ 4.
Kandidatuddannelsen i revision består af følgende tre blokke med det angivne omfang udtrykt i ECTS-points:
En obligatorisk blok (1. og 2. semester)
60 ECTS-points. På 1. semester (efterårssemesteret) udbydes modul 1-fagene. På 2.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 42)
text_chunk:
semester (forårssemesteret) udbydes modul 2-fagene.
En valgfri blok (3. semester)
30 ECTS-points
En specialeblok (4.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 43)
text_chunk:
semester)
30 ECTS-points
Specialeblokken består af udarbejdelsen af en skriftlig afhandling (kandidatspecialet), der skal tjene til afprøvning af den studerendes evne til faglig fordybelse og til selvstændigt at beskrive, analysere og bearbejde en kompleks problemstilling på kandidatniveau.
Stk. 2.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 44)
text_chunk: Studerende indskrevet på erhvervskandidatordningen sammensætter i udgangspunktet selv deres forløb ud fra strukturen angivet i stk. 3 - dog skal den studerende kunne færdiggøre studiet inden for den fastsatte tidsfrist for uddannelsen, jf. § 1, stk. 4-6.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 45)
text_chunk:
Især de erhvervskandidatstuderende skal være opmærksomme på, at fagene er fastlagt til et bestemt semester, således at modul 1-fagene kun udbydes i efterårssemesteret og modul 2-fagene kun i forårssemesteret. Hovedparten af alle valgfag udbydes i efterårssemesteret.
Stk. 3.

De enkelte kursers omfang i ECTS og deres placering på uddannelsen fremgår af nedenstående oversigt. Kursusbeskrivelserne findes i
det elektroniske kursuskatalog
. Direkte links findes i nedenstående skema.

section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 49)
text_chunk: Prøverne i modul 2 (Skatteret 2, Erhvervsret 2, Regnskab 2 og Revision 2) forudsætter faglig indsigt svarende til deltagelse i fagene i modul 1 (Skatteret 1, Erhvervsret 1, Regnskab 1 og Revision 1). De studerende opfordres derfor til at følge undervisningsforløbet som angivet i stk. 3.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 50)
text_chunk:
Det er dog muligt at deltage i prøven i et modul 2-fag, uden at tilsvarende modul 1-fag er bestået. Se nærmere om tilmeldingsregler for fuldtidsstuderende i § 14.
Stk. 5. Det forventes, at den studerende kan læse faglige tekster på engelsk samt modtage undervisning på engelsk.
Valgfag
Stk.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 51)
text_chunk:
6.
Den valgfri blok omfatter 30 ECTS valgfag, der kan vælges inden for eller tilgrænsende
cand.merc.aud.-uddannelsens faglige område. Der skelnes mellem to typer valgfag:
a. Valgfag hvori der aflægges eksamen ved cand.merc.aud.-studiet på CBS.
b.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 52)
text_chunk:
Valgfag der meritoverføres på grundlag af en prøve aflagt ved et af CBS’ andre kandidat-
studier eller ved en anden højere læreanstalt i Danmark eller udlandet. Meritoverførsel god-
kendes af studienævnet for cand.merc.aud. under hensyntagen til helheden og niveauet i
uddannelsen.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 53)
text_chunk:
Studienævnet fastsætter nærmere regler om proceduren ved godkendelse og
forhåndsgodkendelse af valgfri fag, der ønskes meritoverført.
Stk. 7. De i stk. 6, litra a, nævnte valgfag udbydes af cand.merc.aud.-studiet, men kan dog også oprettes på initiativ af en gruppe studerende (såkaldte studiekredse).

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 54)
text_chunk: Oprettelse af studiekredse skal godkendes af cand.merc.aud.-studienævnet. Endvidere er oprettelse betinget af, at et rimeligt antal studerende ønsker at deltage i studiekredsen, at en lærer påtager sig ansvaret for studiekredsens gennemførelse, samt at uddannelsen har ressourcer til oprettelsen.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 55)
text_chunk:
Studiekredse kan godkendes med reduceret ressourcetildeling. Et udbudt fag, der ikke oprettes på grund af for få tilmeldte studerende, kan ikke godkendes som studiekreds.
Stk. 8. CBS udgiver halvårligt på CBS’ hjemmeside en oversigt over de under stk. 6, litra a, nævnte valgfag, der udbydes.
Stk. 9.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 56)
text_chunk: Studienævnet for cand.merc.aud. træffer halvårligt afgørelse om, i hvilke af de i stk. 6, litra a, nævnte valgfag der vil blive opført og gennemført.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 57)
text_chunk:
Beslutningen om hvilke fag, der oprettes, træffes på grundlag af antallet af tilmeldte studerende, studiets faglige profil samt de tildelte undervisningsressourcer. Studienævnet fastsætter i den forbindelse antallet af konfrontationstimer i fagene.
Stk. 10.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 58)
text_chunk:
Cand.merc.aud.-studienævnet godkender ikke projektorienterede forløb.
Kandidatspeciale
§ 4A.
Kandidatspecialet skal dokumentere færdigheder i at anvende videnskabelige teorier og metoder under arbejdet med et fagligt afgrænset emne.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 59)
text_chunk:
Specialet skal placeres på kandidatuddannelsens sidste studieår.
Stk. 2. Studielederen, eller den af ham/hende bemyndigede, godkender opgaveformuleringen for kandidatspecialet og fastsætter samtidig hermed en afleveringsfrist for specialet, jf. stk.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 60)
text_chunk:
3, og en plan for specialevejledning af den studerende.  Tilmelding til kandidatspecialet skal ske senest den 15. november på den studerendes 3. semester, ved indlevering af specialekontrakt; jf. dog § 14, stk. 3. Jf. desuden § 19, stk. 7.
Stk. 3. Afleveringsfristen for specialet er den 15.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 61)
text_chunk:
maj på den studerendes 4. semester, og framelding kan ikke finde sted, når kontrakten er godkendt. Hvis den studerende ikke afleverer inden for fristen, har den studerende brugt et eksamensforsøg, medmindre der er dispenseret i medfør af § 14, stk. 7.
Stk. 4.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 62)
text_chunk: Hvis den studerende ikke afleverer specialet inden for den i stk. 3 fastsatte frist, godkender studielederen, eller den af ham/hende bemyndigede, en ændret opgaveformulering, der skal ligge inden for samme emneområde, og fastsætter samtidig hermed en ny afleveringsfrist på tre måneder.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 63)
text_chunk:
Hvis den studerende ikke afleverer specialet inden for den nye frist, kan den studerende få et tredje prøveforsøg, jf. eksamensbekendtgørelsen, efter samme regler, som gælder for andet prøveforsøg.
Stk. 5. Reglerne i stk.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 64)
text_chunk:
4 finder tilsvarende anvendelse for specialer, hvis den studerende ved bedømmelsen ikke opnår mindst karakteren 02, jf. karakterbekendtgørelsen.
Stk. 6. Opgaveformuleringen for specialet skal godkendes forud for vejledningsforløbet. Der skal gøres brug af en vejleder.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 65)
text_chunk:
Vejlederen skal være ansat af CBS og den studerende tager selv kontakt til vejlederen. Det er tilladt at anvende én bivejleder sammen med hovedvejlederen. Der henvises i øvrigt til Retningslinjer for kandidatspecialekontrakter ved kandidatuddannelser på CBS.
Stk. 7.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 66)
text_chunk:
Emnet for specialet vælges af den studerende inden for studiets obligatoriske fag og faglige profil.
Stk. 8.  Det er en forudsætning for at påbegynde specialet, at de obligatoriske fag på 1.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 67)
text_chunk:
semester (Revision 1, regnskab 1, Erhvervsret 1 eller Skatteret 1) inden for hvilket område der skrives speciale, er bestået inden aflevering af specialet.
Stk. 9.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 68)
text_chunk:
Under udarbejdelsen af specialet er den studerende berettiget til at modtage et vist antal timers vejledning, se nærmere i kursusbeskrivelsen, jf. link i § 4, stk. 3.
Stk. 10. Studerende indskrevet på erhvervskandidatordningen er ikke omfattet af stk.

section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 69)
text_chunk: 2-3, for så vidt angår tilmeldingsfristen (indsendelse af kontrakt) til specialet og afleveringsfristen. De studerende skal aflevere speciale den 15. maj på deres 8. semester, eller 15. november på deres 7. semester, med godkendelse af kontrakt den 15. maj hhv. den 15.

Særlige bestemmelser for cand.merc.aud.

på erhvervskandidatordningen
§ 9.
For studerende indskrevet på erhvervskandidatordningen gælder de generelle bestemmelser i kapitel 2 og 3, dog med undtagelse af § 14 om til- og afmelding til fag og prøver.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 77)
text_chunk:
I stedet gælder bestemmelserne i § 9A
Til- og framelding til fag og prøver
§ 9A.
Erhvervskandidatstuderende skal tilmelde sig 30 ECTS pr. studieår.
Stk. 2. De studerende tilmelder sig valgfag via Selvbetjeningen.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 78)
text_chunk:
Studerende, der ikke er tilmeldt obligatoriske fag og valgfag svarende til mindst 30 ECTS på et studieår, skal selv tilmelde sig valgfag, herunder sommerskolefag, svarende til de manglende ECTS i det kommende semester, således at den studerende i alt er tilmeldt mindst 30 ECTS i det kommende studieår.
Stk.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 79)
text_chunk: 3. Inden for en frameldingsperiode kan de studerende framelde sig fag, de er tilmeldt, hvis tilmeldingen jf. stk. 1 er mere end 30 ECTS på et studieår eller mere end 15 ECTS på et semester, således at de i alt kun er tilmeldt 30 ECTS på et studieår/15 ECTS på et semester.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 80)
text_chunk:
Der er et frameldingsvindue både forud for forårs- og efterårssemestret.
Stk. 4. Ved udvælgelse til valgfag anvendes lodtrækning blandt de studerende, der opfylder betingelserne for at kunne tage det pågældende valgfag, hvis der er flere ansøgere til faget, end der er pladser til rådighed.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 81)
text_chunk:
For visse valgfag sker udvælgelsen ikke ved lodtrækning, men i stedet på baggrund af en motiveret ansøgning; det vil fremgå af valgfagsudbuddet på cbs.dk.
Stk. 5.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 82)
text_chunk: Den studerende er automatisk tilmeldt til prøven/prøverne, når den studerende er tilmeldt et fag eller fagelement, hvortil der er tilknyttet en eller flere prøver, jf. også § 15 om omprøver. Framelding kan ikke finde sted til den ordinære prøve (1. prøveforsøg), og der er brugt et prøveforsøg, jf.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 83)
text_chunk:
§ 27, stk. 1, medmindre der er dispenseret i medfør af stk. 6. Opfylder den studerende ikke de af universitetet fastsatte forudsætninger for at deltage i prøven, jf. § 13, stk. 1, er der brugt et prøveforsøg, jf. § 27, stk. 1, medmindre der er dispenseret i medfør af stk. 6.
Stk. 6.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 84)
text_chunk: Universitetet kan dispensere fra reglerne i stk. 5, hvis der foreligger usædvanlige forhold, herunder funktionsnedsættelse.

page_name: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision
section_title: Cand.merc.aud. - kandidatuddannelsen i revision (Part 85)
text_chunk:

§ 10.
